page.title: 09Gourdon's Harbour Mistress
page.content: For almost 2 years Mrs. Marion (Penny) Gove has been{harbour mistress although she came to Gourdon 15 years ago. She first became harbour mistress when she applied to the Council when the job was advertised and no fishermen were interested. As harbour mistress she has a variety of jobs to do such as keeping the books, going to the bank and knowing how the hydraulic gates work. She likes the job even more as time goes on because she likes working out of doors. There is a {superstition}that a woman is bad luck on the pier when the boats go out to sea so Mrs. Gove tries to hide on such occasions. She works on a Sunday because yachts come in anytime in the Summer. She is waiting for a fisherman to retire who will want the job and then she is quite prepared to give up.
